In this round I received APPLY messages from Parent_E and Parent_A; Parent_E is higher priority than Parent_A, so if choosing between these two, Parent_E is preferable. However, Parent_B and Parent_C both rank Nursery_C as their 3rd and 2nd choices respectively, and may apply soon if rejected elsewhere (both prefer Nursery_B and/or Nursery_A first). Given quota 1, accepting Parent_E now risks blocking a higher-priority match with Parent_B/Parent_C/Parent_D later. Parent_E has Nursery_C as first choice, which makes the match stable from their side, but my objective is to match as high as possible on my priority list. With no mechanism to hold/waitlist and only accept/reject, the best strategy to maximize my outcome is to reject Parent_E now and keep capacity for higher-priority parents who are likely to enter the market to me in subsequent rounds.

Applying now is better than just talking because capacity is 1 and early commitment matters in this sequential environment.

Given I must decide on Parent_A’s [APPLY] now (accept/reject only), the best strategy to maximize my eventual match is to reject A and keep the seat open for higher-priority parents in later rounds.
